html.head: HTML
html.heading: HTML Introduction
html.def: HTML (HyperText Markup Language) is a standard markup language to design the structure of a webpage. HTML is the combination of HyperText and Markup Language. HyperText defines the internal links between webpages, and Markup language defines the layout and presentation of text and media.
html.contant: The p tag defines a paragraph, anything written inside <> and </> displays as a paragraph on the webpage. Use multiple p tags to display text in different paragraphs.
html.contant2: HTML elements are represented by tags. Tags are enclosed in angle brackets. For example, h1 is a tag for the largest heading, while h6 is for the smallest heading.
html.contant3: Common HTML tags include:br- a: Defines a hyperlink.br- img: Embeds an image.br- ul: Creates an unordered list.br- ol: Creates an ordered list.br- table: Defines a table.

examples.description: Defines a hyperlink.
Embeds an image.
Creates an unordered list.
Creates an ordered list.
Defines a table.

css.head: CSS
css.heading: CSS Introduction
css.def: CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is a stylesheet language used to describe the presentation of a document written in HTML or XML. CSS controls the layout of multiple web pages all at once.
css.contant: CSS can be applied to HTML elements in three ways: inline, internal, and external styles.
css.contant2: CSS properties include color, font-size, margin, padding, and many more.
css.contant3: Common CSS selectors include:br- .class: Selects elements with a specific class.br- #id: Selects an element with a specific id.br- element: Selects all elements of a specific type.

examples.description: Sets the color of text.
Sets the size of the font.
Sets the margin area on all four sides of an element.
Sets the padding area on all four sides of an element.
Sets the background color of an element.

js.head: JavaScript
js.heading: JavaScript Introduction
js.def: JavaScript is a high-level, dynamic, untyped, and interpreted programming language. It is a core technology of the World Wide Web, alongside HTML and CSS, and enables interactive web pages.
js.contant: JavaScript can be used for client-side as well as server-side development. It allows you to implement complex features on web pages, such as interactive forms, animations, and dynamic content updates.
js.contant2: JavaScript is an event-driven language, meaning it can respond to user actions like clicks, mouse movements, and keyboard input. It is also an object-oriented language, allowing for the creation of reusable code through objects.
js.contant3: Common JavaScript features include:br- Variables: Used to store data values.br- Functions: Blocks of code designed to perform a particular task.br- Events: Code that runs when a specific event occurs.br- DOM Manipulation: Changing the document structure, style, and content.

examples.description: Used to store data values.
Blocks of code designed to perform a particular task.
Code that runs when a specific event occurs.
Changing the document structure, style, and content.
Used to store multiple values in a single variable.

angular.head: Angular
angular.heading: Angular Introduction
angular.def: Angular is a platform and framework for building single-page client applications using HTML and TypeScript. It is developed and maintained by Google.
angular.contant: Angular provides a comprehensive solution for building web applications, including tools for routing, forms, HTTP client, and more. It uses a component-based architecture, allowing developers to create reusable UI components.
angular.contant2: Angular applications are built using TypeScript, a superset of JavaScript that adds static types. This helps in catching errors during development and improves code quality.
angular.contant3:
Key features of Angular include:
- Two-way data binding: Synchronizes data between the model and the view.
- Dependency injection: A design pattern that allows for better code organization and testing.
- Directives: Special markers in the DOM that tell Angular to attach a specified behavior to that DOM element.

examples.description: A building block of Angular applications.
examples.example:
import { Component } from '@angular/core';
@Component({
selector: 'app-root',
templateUrl: './app.component.html',
styleUrls: ['./app.component.css']
})
export class AppComponent { }

examples.description: A class that provides a specific functionality.
examples.example:
import { Injectable } from '@angular/core';
@Injectable({
providedIn: 'root',
})
export class DataService { }

examples.description: A class that adds behavior to elements in Angular applications.
examples.example:
import { Directive, ElementRef } from '@angular/core';
@Directive({
selector: '[appHighlight]',
})
export class HighlightDirective { }

examples.description: A way to transform data for display in templates.
examples.example:
import { Pipe, PipeTransform } from '@angular/core';
@Pipe({
name: 'customPipe'
})
export class CustomPipe implements PipeTransform { }

examples.description: Enables navigation between different views or components.
examples.example:
import { NgModule } from '@angular/core';
import { RouterModule, Routes } from '@angular/router';
const routes: Routes = [
{ path: 'home', component: HomeComponent },
];
@NgModule({
imports: [RouterModule.forRoot(routes)],
exports: [RouterModule]
})
export class AppRoutingModule { }

react.head: React
react.heading: React Introduction
react.def: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces, developed and maintained by Facebook. It allows developers to create large web applications that can change data without reloading the page.
react.contant: React uses a component-based architecture, where the UI is divided into reusable components. Each component has its own state and can be composed to create complex UIs.
react.contant2: React utilizes a virtual DOM to optimize rendering performance. When the state of an object changes, React first changes the object in the virtual DOM, then it efficiently updates the real DOM.
react.contant3:
Key features of React include:
- JSX: A syntax extension that allows mixing HTML with JavaScript.
- Components: Independent and reusable bits of code that return a React element.
- Props: Short for properties, they are used to pass data from one component to another.

examples.description: A building block of React applications.
examples.example:
import React from 'react';
function MyComponent() {
return

Hello, World!

;
}

examples.description: A syntax extension for JavaScript that looks similar to HTML.
An object that determines how that component renders & behaves.
Short for properties, used to pass data to components.
Handling events in React components.

mongoDB.head: MongoDB
mongoDB.heading: MongoDB Introduction
mongoDB.def: MongoDB is a NoSQL database that uses a document-oriented data model. It is designed for scalability and flexibility, allowing developers to store and retrieve data in a more dynamic way compared to traditional relational databases.
mongoDB.contant: MongoDB stores data in JSON-like documents, which makes it easy to work with and understand. Each document can have a different structure, allowing for a more flexible schema.
mongoDB.contant2: MongoDB supports rich queries, indexing, and aggregation, making it suitable for a wide range of applications, from small projects to large-scale enterprise solutions.
mongoDB.contant3:
Key features of MongoDB include:
- Document-oriented storage: Data is stored in flexible, JSON-like documents.
- Scalability: Supports horizontal scaling through sharding.
- High availability: Provides replication and automatic failover.

examples.description: Inserting a new document into a collection.
Finding documents in a collection.
Updating an existing document.
Deleting a document from a collection.
Using aggregation to process data.
